actions.name: Fearless Defender
actions.trigger: An allied character in Range 3 takes damage from a hostile source.
actions.detail: You may move to a space adjacent to the ally and take the damage (but not the other effects) instead.

name: Roughhouse Subroutines
effect: Gain +1 Accuracy when making a melee attack against a Slowed or Immobilized target.

synergies.detail: Gain +1 Accuracy when making a melee attack against a Slowed or Immobilized target.

name: Sledgehammer Servos
effect: Your Improvised Attacks gain Knockback 2 and deal 2d6+2 damage.

name: CQB Enhancement Suite
effect:
As long as you're Engaged, you and any allies adjacent to you count as having soft cover.

You don't gain Difficulty from being Engaged.

name: Shepherd Neural Net
effect:
Your Drone systems gain +5 HP. Additionally, gain the Shepherd Drone Protocol.

1/round, when you make an attack that consumes the Lock On condition, your Drones immediately emit a vicious pulse of energy. All characters of your choice within Burst 1 areas centered on each of your drones take 1d6 Energy damage. Each character can only be affected by the pulse from one drone, even if the areas overlap.

actions.name: Shepherd Drone
actions.detail: Move a drone you control up to 4 spaces if it is within Sensors.

name: Harrier Subroutines
effect:
The first time on your turn that you attack a hostile character within Range 3, hit or miss, you may give them the Exemplar’s Mark as a free action. Characters can only have one Exemplar’s Mark at a time – new marks from any character replace existing marks.

The character has the Exemplar’s Mark until the start of your next turn, and while they have it, if they attack a character other than you while within Range 3, they trigger your Overwatch.

actions.detail:
You enter a duel with a hostile character within Sensors and line of sight. While in the duel, the target must make a Systems save at the start of each of their turns. On a failure, until the start of the target’s next turn, they receive +3 Difficulty on all attacks that don’t include you as a target, and they cannot voluntarily move away from you.

The duel lasts until the end of the scene, until you take this action again, or until you or your opponent is destroyed. Each character cannot enter another duel until the current one ends.
